title: Example uncertainty and sensitivity
text: document describe steps one can take determine uncertainty input parameters propagates CENTURY model. also specify procedures used quantify sensitivity parameters. start giving necessary definitions. stated (Taylor 2022), ‘Error analysis study evaluation uncertainty measurement’. hand, can define sensitivity analysis ‘study uncertainty output model (numerical otherwise) can apportioned different sources uncertainty model input’ (Saltelli et al. 2004). can seen, topics may sound somehow related even seemingly partially overlap. can use Rcentury package assess uncertainties (aka errors) model’s parameters contribute overall uncertainty output. general, many models possible derive approximate analytical expressions n-error error propagation using Taylor expansions, involves calculating analytical n-order derivatives. However, approach quickly becomes cumbersome impractical number parameters grows high , especially, function evaluate complex non-linear like CENTURY. Therefore, determine error propagation CENTURY model turn much simpler Monte Carlo numerical approach, consists feeding model input parameters interests vary randomly model run following given distribution known mean variance. sake simplicity demonstrate perform uncertainty propagation analysis soil texture (.e. clay, silt sand) , keeping parameters model fixed. case, model run draw random proportion values three parameters, calculate CENTURY model values save output. done many times derive reliable confidence intervals output. Soil texture given set 3 proportions add 1 always, thus need specify random distribution accounts property. Consequently, turn Dirichlet distributions, allow us model probability distributions outcomes categorical events, total probability adds one. details, see Annex .

title: Example uncertainty and sensitivity
text: example use forest data CENTURY example files. create temporary directory move necessary files (ASCII data files executables). simulation carried -called 𝚍𝚞𝚔𝚎.𝟷𝟶𝟶\texttt{duke.100} file example, though site .  also need package 𝚎𝚡𝚝𝚛𝚊𝙳𝚒𝚜𝚝𝚛\texttt{extraDistr}, available CRAN, provide us random-number generator Dirichlet distribution. also load Rcentury package.  intend model propagation uncertainty , sensitivity , texture parameters. parameters included 𝚍𝚞𝚔𝚎.𝟷𝟶𝟶\texttt{duke.100} site file, read 𝚌𝚎𝚗𝚝𝚞𝚛𝚢_𝟺𝟽.𝚎𝚡𝚎\texttt{century_47.exe} execution. Consequently, use package functions 𝚛𝚎𝚊𝚍_𝚜𝚒𝚝𝚎.𝚁\texttt{read_site.R} 𝚠𝚛𝚒𝚝𝚎_𝚜𝚒𝚝𝚎.𝚁\texttt{write_site.R} read site data write back onto disk simulation step. output CENTURY model may include approximately 600 variables, example focus total system carbon (variable totsysctotsysc).  performed simulations, can proceed determine uncertainty propagates model sensitivity three soil components.
code: # Copy all files to temporary folder. from_dir <- system.file("extdata/4.forest",  package = "Rcentury") to_dir <- tempdir() invisible(file.copy(from_dir, to_dir, overwrite = TRUE, recursive = TRUE)) path_exe <- system.file("bin/windows",  package = "Rcentury") century_exe <- file.path(path_exe, "century_47.exe") list100_exe <- file.path(path_exe, "list100_47.exe") to_dir <- file.path(to_dir, "4.forest") invisible(file.copy(century_exe, to_dir, overwrite = TRUE, recursive = TRUE)) invisible(file.copy(list100_exe, to_dir, overwrite = TRUE, recursive = TRUE)) # install.packages("extraDistr") library(extraDistr) #> Warning: package 'extraDistr' was built under R version 4.4.3 library(Rcentury) # Read site characteristics and extract sand, slit and clay values. site <- site2 <- read_site(to_dir, "duke.100") x <- site$`site and control`$df sand <- x$value[x$field == "SAND"] silt <- x$value[x$field == "SILT"] clay <- x$value[x$field == "CLAY"] alpha <- dirichlet_params(c(sand, silt, clay), c(NA, .01, NA))  # We need an ASCII text file with a list of variables to extract; in this case, only $totsysc$. cat("totsysc", file = file.path(to_dir, "totsysc.txt"))  # Finally, the simulations. nsimu <- 100 texture <- matrix(0, 3, nsimu) df <- list() for (i in 1:nsimu) {      # Random Dirichlet triplet.   texture_random <- rdirichlet(1, alpha)   texture[, i] <- texture_random      # Save <site>.100 file.   x <- site2$`site and control`$df   x$value[x$field == "SAND"] <- texture_random[1]   x$value[x$field == "SILT"] <- texture_random[2]   x$value[x$field == "CLAY"] <- texture_random[3]   site2$`site and control`$df <- x   write_site(site2, to_dir, "duke.100", overwrite = TRUE)      df[[i]] <- century_run(to_dir, "duke.sch", "res.bin", "res.lis", "totsysc.txt", verbose = FALSE)   invisible(file.remove(file.path(to_dir, c("res.bin", "res.lis")))) }

title: Example uncertainty and sensitivity
code: x <- df[[1]]$time z <- sapply(df, function(x) x$totsysc) y <- apply(z, 1, mean) ci_lo <- apply(z, 1, quantile, prob = 0.025) ci_up <- apply(z, 1, quantile, prob = 0.975) plot(x, y, type = "l", ylim = c(0, max(z)), xlab = "Time (years)", ylab = "Total system C") polygon(c(x, rev(x)), c(ci_lo, rev(ci_up)), col = "skyblue", border = NA) points(x, y, type = "l")

title: Example uncertainty and sensitivity
text: determine model sensitivity three texture parameters apply
code: par(mfcol = c(2, 1)) nx <- length(x) cc <- sapply(2:nx, function(i) sapply(1:3, function(j) cor(texture[j,], z[i,])^2)) plot(2:nx, cc[1, ], ylim = c(0, 1), xlab = "Time (years)", ylab = "R-squared",      col = "red", type = "l", lwd = 2) points(2:nx, cc[2, ], col = "blue", type = "l", lwd = 2) points(2:nx, cc[3, ], col = "green", type = "l", lwd = 2) legend("right", col = c("red", "blue", "green"), lwd = 2, legend = c("Sand", "Silt", "Clay"))  cn <- sweep(cc, 2, apply(cc, 2, sum), FUN = "/") plot(2:nx, cn[1, ], ylim = c(0, 1), xlab = "Time (years)", ylab = "Normalized R-squared",      col = "red", type = "l", lwd = 2) points(2:nx, cn[2, ], col = "blue", type = "l", lwd = 2) points(2:nx, cn[3, ], col = "green", type = "l", lwd = 2) legend("topright", col = c("red", "blue", "green"), lwd = 2, legend = c("Sand", "Silt", "Clay")) par(mfrow = c(1, 1))

what: Annex: How to draw multivariate proportions
title: Example uncertainty and sensitivity
text: means proportions fixed simulations. f(x1,…,xK;α1,…,αK)=1B(𝛂)∏=1Kxiαi−1f(x_1, \dots, x_K; \alpha_1, \dots, \alpha_K) = \frac{1}{B(\boldsymbol{\alpha})} \prod_{=1}^K x_i^{\alpha_i - 1} : B(𝛂)=∏=1KΓ(αi)Γ(∑=1Kαi)B(\boldsymbol{\alpha}) = \frac{\prod_{=1}^K \Gamma(\alpha_i)}{\Gamma(\sum_{=1}^K \alpha_i)} : xi∈[0,1],∈{1,…,K}x_i \[0, 1], \quad \text{} \\{1, \dots, K\} well : ∑=1Kxi=1\sum_{=1}^K x_i = 1 mean xix_i , : E[xi]=αi∑j=1KαjE[x_i] = \frac{\alpha_i}{\sum_{j=1}^K \alpha_j} expression variance : Var[xi]=αĩ⋅(1−αĩ)α0−1Var[x_i] = \frac{\tilde{\alpha_i}\cdot(1-\tilde{\alpha_i})}{\alpha_0-1} : αĩ=αiα0\tilde{\alpha_i}=\frac{\alpha_i}{\alpha_0} can use two expressions calculate αj\alpha_j values given four parameters E[xi]E[x_i] E[Vi]E[V_i]. Rcentury package provides function, called 𝚍𝚒𝚛𝚒𝚌𝚑𝚕𝚎𝚝_𝚙𝚊𝚛𝚊𝚖𝚜.𝚁\texttt{dirichlet_params.R}, can calculate αj\alpha_j values means E[xi] ∈{1,…,K}E[x_i]\text{ } \\{1, \dots, K\} one single variance value Var[xj]Var[x_j] known. example, K=3K=3 E[x1]=.35E[x_1]=.35, E[x2]=.12E[x_2]=.12, E[x3]=.53E[x_3]=.53 Var[x2]=.17Var[x_2]=.17, can easily generate sequences Dirichlet-distributed triplets.
code: alpha <- dirichlet_params(c(.28, .60, .12), c(NA, .01, NA)) x <- rdirichlet(100000, alpha) par(mfrow = c(1, 3)) hist(x[, 1], xlab = "", main = "Sand", breaks = seq(0, 1, length = 50)) hist(x[, 2], xlab = "", main = "Silt", breaks = seq(0, 1, length = 50)) hist(x[, 3], xlab = "", main = "Clay", breaks = seq(0, 1, length = 50)) par(mfrow = c(1,1))

title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {Rcentury: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)},   author = {First Last},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://emf-creaf.github.io/Rcentury/}, }

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: goal Rcentury R package run CENTURY soil dynamics simulation R command window. Since provide external software R package, first need download install Fortran version CENTURY 4.7 software locally. can done directly web site https://www.soilcarbonsolutionscenter.com filling form. Two zip-files automatically downloaded, must unzipped local folder choice. uncompressed folders contain necessary files, plus several user manuals examples. question related CENTURY must addressed directly creators software. See contact information https://www.soilcarbonsolutionscenter.com web page. CENTURY Fortran executable can used stand-alone software run Windows command-prompt console. , just follow instructions accompanying documents. Additionally, series ASCII files must also prepared advance, read CENTURY executed. files include: set 11 option files extension ‘.100’, containing large set parameters. name files fixed. single site file, also extension ‘.100’, containing site-specific parameters. name file can chosen . weather file, extension ‘.wth’, includes monthly data precipitation minimum maximum temperature site. schedule file, extension ‘.sch’, details timing sequence events simulation. ASCII files, together executable ‘.exe’ programs, must exist folder. CENTURY 4.7 example files can used starting templates prepare parameter files. example files located three sub-folders created unzipping CENTURY downloaded files: Grassland grazing simulation ran site Xilingol, Mongolia (sub-folder “/Century+Examples/Century Examples/1.soil_texture_ppt”). Plant production different grass types different relative temperature growth curves (sub-folder “/Century+Examples/Century Examples/3.plant_production”). DUke Harvard forests (sub-folder “/Century+Examples/Century Examples/4.forest”). folders can also find two executables century_47.exe list100_47.exe use simulations.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Editing saving disk input ASCII files individually extremely tedious challenging task, particularly goal apply CENTURY model large number different sites, /variety different climatic land management scenarios. manual process also highly susceptible errors, given vast number parameters must carefully tuned-adjusted. Therefore, significant improvement workflow able perform file operations within comprehensive software environment like R. mentioned , goal package Rcentury thus run CENTURY 4.7 (version Fortran) within R. includes preparing files (treatments, schedule, weather site characteristic), read load result files R session data.frame. Notice Rcentury implementation CENTURY equations R code. Rather, interface original CENTURY Fortran code R, guarantees calculations done via actual CENTURY code.

what: How to set up the Rcentury session
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: run CENTURY R session Rcentury package may proceed follows. First, package Rcentury must install local computer. package publicly available github can easily fetched: , load R session: ensures package functions available R session. Access folders granted using R function “system.file”:
code: devtools::install_github("https://github.com/emf-creaf/Rcentury.git") #> Using GitHub PAT from the git credential store. #> Downloading GitHub repo emf-creaf/Rcentury@HEAD #> ── R CMD build ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>          checking for file 'C:\Users\Roberto\AppData\Local\Temp\Rtmpuy8arK\remotes44a43da03685\emf-creaf-Rcentury-425a058/DESCRIPTION' ...  ✔  checking for file 'C:\Users\Roberto\AppData\Local\Temp\Rtmpuy8arK\remotes44a43da03685\emf-creaf-Rcentury-425a058/DESCRIPTION' #>       ─  preparing 'Rcentury': (5.7s) #>    checking DESCRIPTION meta-information ...  ✔  checking DESCRIPTION meta-information #>       ─  checking for LF line-endings in source and make files and shell scripts #>   ─  checking for empty or unneeded directories #> ─  building 'Rcentury_0.0.0.9000.tar.gz' #>       #>  #> Installing package into 'C:/Users/Roberto/AppData/Local/R/win-library/4.4' #> (as 'lib' is unspecified) library(Rcentury) # Get paths. path_in <- c(system.file("extdata/1.soil_texture_ppt",  package = "Rcentury"),              system.file("extdata/3.plant_production",  package = "Rcentury"),              system.file("extdata/4.forest",  package = "Rcentury")) # Check folder content. # sapply(path_in, dir)

previous_headings: How to set up the Rcentury session
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: steps follow prepare CENTURY simulation Rcentury package follows: Download CENTURY 4.7 files two compressed zip files (October 2025) web site. Unfold zip files local folder. end series subfolders enclose manuals example files. Next, create directory hold required CENTURY files results simulations. files include 4 types files described . Open RStudio three example simulations accompany CENTURY ‘.zip’ files. ASCII files required CENTURY software can read write functions provided Rcentury package: read_100/write_100: read/write CENTURY files extension ’*.100’ save site files. read_site/write_site: read/write ers create input site files (extension ‘.100’) CENTURY soil model. read_weather/write_weather: read_schedule/write_schedule: read/write *.sch CENTURY files. read_lis: functions allow us first read example files provided CENTURY software, change parameters write modified dataset disk. files available directory two ‘.exe’ files located, can run CENTURY ‘century_run.R’ function. Internally, ‘century_run.R’ runs sequentially ‘century_47.exe’ ‘list100_47.exe’, creating first ‘.bin’ file ASCII ‘.lis’, finally read ‘read_lis.R’ function. output latter , finally, data.frame can manipulated analysed within R.

what: Run CENTURY simulations and load results into the R session — century_run
title: Run CENTURY simulations and load results into the R session — century_run
text: century_run

title: Run CENTURY simulations and load results into the R session — century_run
code: century_run(   pathname = pathname,   schedule = schedule,   name_bin = name_bin,   name_lis = name_lis,   name_txt = name_txt,   overwrite = TRUE,   extended = FALSE,   erase_bin = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Run CENTURY simulations and load results into the R session — century_run
text: pathname character string valid path folder. schedule character string name valid schedule file (extension '.sch') name_bin character string name give output '.bin' file. name_lis character string name give output '.lis' ASCII file. name_txt character string specifying name ASCII text (extension '.txt') file contains, single column, name fields extract results. overwrite logical, set TRUE file already exists, overwrite; set FALSE file exists, stop error message. extended character flag "Y" "N" decide whether computation corresponds extended one (see CENTURY manual, section 6-1, details). erase_bin logical, set TRUE (default) '.bin' file results CENTURY simulation erased calculations done. verbose logical, set TRUE (default) information execution printed screen.

what: Calculate parameters required in a Dirichlet distribution — dirichlet_params
title: Calculate parameters required in a Dirichlet distribution — dirichlet_params
text: dirichlet_params calculates 'alpha' values Dirichlet distribution mean values one variance value.

title: Calculate parameters required in a Dirichlet distribution — dirichlet_params
code: dirichlet_params(mean = mean, variance = variance)

title: Calculate parameters required in a Dirichlet distribution — dirichlet_params
text: mean numerical vector, length variance, containing mean values component Dirichlet distribution. variance numerical vector, one non-NA element variance value.

title: Calculate parameters required in a Dirichlet distribution — dirichlet_params
text: corresponding alpha values Dirichlet distribution. alpha values negative variance decreased. warning issued case.

title: Calculate parameters required in a Dirichlet distribution — dirichlet_params
text: Input mean vector must contain mean values component Dirichlet distribution. one value missing (signaled NA) calculated sum mean values. turn, one variance value must introduced elements variance vector must NA.

title: Calculate parameters required in a Dirichlet distribution — dirichlet_params
code: # Mean and variance values as input. m <- c(.3, .23,.27, .2) v <- c(NA, .1, NA, NA) alpha <- dirichlet_params(m, v)  # Calculate mean values from alpha. print(alpha/sum(alpha)) #> [1] 0.30 0.23 0.27 0.20  # Calculate variance values from alpha. alpha0 <- sum(alpha) beta <- alpha / alpha0 print(beta*(1-beta)/(1+alpha0)) #> [1] 0.11857708 0.10000000 0.11129305 0.09034444

what: Split character string in two parts — splitin2
title: Split character string in two parts — splitin2
text: splitin2 splints character string two-element data.frame containing number string, order.

title: Split character string in two parts — splitin2
code: splitin2(x, input_type = input_type, remove_quotes = TRUE)

title: Split character string in two parts — splitin2
text: x single character string. input_type character string can take two values: "data" "title". remove_quotes logical, set TRUE single quotation marks removed second element.

title: Split character string in two parts — splitin2
text: data.frame one row two columns.

title: Split character string in two parts — splitin2
text: Function splitin2 written allow splitting string CENTURY files two parts. Input 'x' must single character string containing either number text (e.g. "45 dd")

title: Split character string in two parts — splitin2
code: # See the difference when 'input_type' changes value. str(splitin2("4.5 'This'", "data")) #> Error in splitin2("4.5 'This'", "data"): could not find function "splitin2" str(splitin2("45 'This'", "title")) #> Error in splitin2("45 'This'", "title"): could not find function "splitin2"  # We set 'remove_quotes' to FALSE. str(splitin2("4.5 'This'", "data", FALSE)) #> Error in splitin2("4.5 'This'", "data", FALSE): could not find function "splitin2" str(splitin2("45 'This'", "title", FALSE)) #> Error in splitin2("45 'This'", "title", FALSE): could not find function "splitin2"

what: Write *.100 input files for Century — write_100
title: Write *.100 input files for Century — write_100
text: write_100 allows users create input files (extension '.100') CENTURY soil model.

title: Write *.100 input files for Century — write_100
code: write_100(   x,   pathname = pathname,   filename = filename,   ndigits = 6,   sep = "    ",   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Write *.100 input files for Century — write_100
text: x list many elements events needed. event starts short label long title. pathname character string valid path folder. filename character string specifying name file extension. ndigits integer specifying number digits print numeric values. sep field separator string. Values within row x separated string. overwrite logical, set FALSE (default), code stop file already exists. set TRUE, previous file overwritten.

title: Write *.100 input files for Century — write_100
text: Nothing. File created disk.

title: Write *.100 input files for Century — write_100
text: stage almost checks whether fields correctly specified. left researcher's task.

title: Write *.100 input files for Century — write_100
code: # Example list with two elements. x <- list()  df <- data.frame(runif(11), c(paste0("cultra(", 1:7, ")"), paste0("clteff(", 1:4, ")"))) colnames(df) <- NULL x[[1]] <- list(label = "E1", title = "Example1", df = df)  df <- data.frame(runif(11), c(paste0("cultra(", 1:7, ")"), paste0("clteff(", 1:4, ")"))) colnames(df) <- NULL x[[2]] <- list(label = "E1", title = "Example1", df = df)  # Create temporary path. path <- tempdir() write_100(x, path, "cult.100")

title: Save to disk a *.sch CENTURY file — write_schedule
text: x list content schedule file. pathname valid path write file . filename character string actual file name. must include extension '.sch'. overwrite logical, set TRUE file already exists, overwrite; set FALSE file exists, stop error message. verbose logical,

what: Write data to a CENTURY site file. — write_site
title: Write data to a CENTURY site file. — write_site
text: write_site allows users create input site files (extension '.100') CENTURY soil model.

title: Write data to a CENTURY site file. — write_site
code: write_site(   x,   pathname = pathname,   filename = filename,   ndigits = 6,   sep = "    ",   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Write data to a CENTURY site file. — write_site
text: x list many elements events needed. pathname character string valid path folder. filename character string specifying name file, must include extension '.100'. overwrite logical, set FALSE (default), code stop file already exists. set TRUE, previous file overwritten.

title: Write data to a CENTURY site file. — write_site
text: writing successful, returns nothing.

title: Write data to a CENTURY site file. — write_site
code: # Reads one of the site files provided with the package. pathname <- system.file("extdata/4.forest",  package = "Rcentury") filename <- "duke.100" x <- read_site(pathname, filename)  # Create temporary path. path <- tempdir() write_site(x, path, "duke.100")

title: Write CENTURY weather file — write_weather
text: write_weather takes input data.frame containing weather data writes '*.wth' CENTURY file disk.

title: Write CENTURY weather file — write_weather
code: write_weather(   df,   pathname = pathname,   filename = filename,   overwrite = FALSE,   sep = "      ",   ndigits = 6 )

title: Write CENTURY weather file — write_weather
text: df data.frame containing weather data (precipitation, maximum minimum temperature). overwrite logical indicating whether overwrite 'fileout' already exists disk. Default 'TRUE'. sep character string separate columns 'fileout'. Default empty character string length 7. ndigits numeric indicating number decimal digits output file. Default 3. fileout character string name (without extension) weather file created. wd character string name valid directory save weather file. Default local folder. verbose logical indicating whether print informative messages. Default 'TRUE'.

title: Write CENTURY weather file — write_weather
text: NULL returned fileout written disk.

title: Write CENTURY weather file — write_weather
text: input data.frame pivoted long wide format fit CENTURY requirements.

title: Write CENTURY weather file — write_weather
code: df<- data.frame(month = rep(1:12, 2),   year = rep(c(2020, 2021), each = 12),   prec = runif(24)*500 + 100,   tmin = rnorm(24, mean = 5),   tmax = rnorm(24, mean = 15)) century_weather(df, "nothing") #> Error in century_weather(df, "nothing"): could not find function "century_weather"
